intro: Tenaris somalensis, commonly known as the Somali tenaris, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows from 30 to 60 centimeters tall, with narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the dry season. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Tenaris somalensis plays a role in local ecosystems and may have traditional uses by indigenous communities.
